quest.name: The View from Above
journal: Urianger is wearing a pensive look.
Ahead of the coming trials, Urianger bids you take your ease while the others carry out the work on the Ladder.

As you observe the final stages of the Ladder's restoration, Emet-Selch arrives unannounced. In the course of waxing sentimental, he raises the prospect of you joining him as an equal─a complete existence in a complete world. No sooner does the Ascian take his leave than Ardbert appears in his place. As the Talos come to life to hearty cheers, he speaks to you of his struggles against solitude, and warns you against making a choice that leaves you alone. At that moment, Alphinaud and Alisaie rush up to you excitedly. The Ladder lives again, and you join the twins as the first souls to ride the lift in twenty years.
While you await the others at Top Rung, Alisaie calls to you from the nearby outlook, and you and Alphinaud hurry to join her.

According to Alisaie, she witnessed someone emerge from the village to the northeast, even though the area is believed to have been abandoned. Lest you doubt her words, she urges you to take a look for yourself.

Scanning the area around the village, you spot the mysterious person, who appeared to be spying in your direction. Uncomfortable at not knowing who is out there, Alisaie suggests that you investigate the village.
While the village appears devoid of people, there is evidence to suggest that it is very much inhabited, and you take your findings to Alphinaud.

As you ponder what to do about the hiding villagers, a voice calls out. It is revealed to belong to none other than Tristol, the young artist whose life you saved in Kholusia. He informs you that the village, Amity, is a settlement for those who survived being exiled from Eulmore, and upon learning that you are in pursuit of Vauthry, promises to aid you in your quest.
objectives: Wait for the work to be completed.
Search the area for the mysterious person.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The work proceeds apace, I'm pleased to say. When it is restored, the Ladder will not only be our way forward; it will represent a momentous step towards lasting change for Kholusia.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I've rounded up as much material as I could for the work. Just my little bit for the cause.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The Eulmorans have rallied quite impressively. Amidst great adversity, a little purpose never goes astray.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename. I heard you went to find lumber.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: From afar, the Ladder looked like it was made entirely of metal, but there's actually a lot of wood if you look for it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: By the intensity with which he works, 'tis as if all of that reluctance was a lie.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Hmph, such a primitive, inefficient design! A much smaller Talos from our company could just as easily perform the same task!

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Oh, he'll have them moving again soon! I know he will!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ah, but prematurely do I give myself to sentimental musings. Many more pressing concerns demand our attention, not the least of which is the matter of how we might reach the mountain, detached from the land as it is.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For the present, 'twould appear we have matters here well in hand. Perhaps thou shouldst take thine ease for a time? Thou wilt need every onze of thy strength for the trials ahead.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thy zeal is commendable, my friend, but rest assured we shall not want for hands. Pray take thine ease in preparation for the trials ahead.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Is that...?

dialogue.name: EULMOREMAN03634
dialogue.text: If you're looking for your friends, they were about to board the lift when someone or other arrived.

dialogue.name: EULMOREMAN03634
dialogue.text: They said not to mind them, that they'll be along soon.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And here we finally are, at Top Rung.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The others should arrive ere long─

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: (-Alisaie-)Alphinaud, Forename! Come up here! There's something I need you to see!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What could this be about?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That appears to be a village...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There's a village, Forename. Over to the northeast.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So there is. Yet after two decades without the Ladder in operation, I would not be surprised if such an isolated settlement had long since been abandoned.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Nor I. But that was before I spied someone leave it and proceed to head in our direction, all the while trying to remain unseen...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Whoever this mysterious person is, they should still be out there. Go on and take a look, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So long as they have the resources to sustain themselves, it's entirely possible that people could still be about...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Go on and take a look, Forename. The mysterious person should still be out there.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search your surroundings for the mysterious person. You may move the camera as well as zoom in and out. Target the figure and inspect them with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There's someone, right? And they were spying on us. Personally, I don't feel comfortable not knowing who they are. What do you say we investigate?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'm curious too, I must admit. And I daresay we have a bit of time ere the others ascend.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's settled, then. Let's head to the village and see if it's indeed inhabited.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The crates and barrels are laden with unknown contents.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I could have sworn I heard a noise...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You hear faint sounds from inside the building. However, the door refuses to budge.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Food has been hung out to dry in the sun, and quite recently by your reckoning.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The cups are half-empty...or half-full, depending on how you see such things. Behind the counter, a kettle bubbles steadily over the stove.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What news, Forename? Were you able to find anything of note?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: People are definitely still living here.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I couldn't find our mysterious person.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Maybe this place really is abandoned.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed. While there's no one to be seen, 'tis plain that this village is anything but abandoned.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nor I. But while there's no one to be seen, 'tis plain that this village is anything but abandoned.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I don't think so, my friend. While there's no one to be seen, 'tis plain that this village is anything but abandoned.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If the villagers are trying to conceal themselves, they are doing a rather poor job of it. But if they don't wish to be seen, what are we to do?

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-???-)I say, aren't you the ones who saved my life?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You're Tristol, the artist from Eulmore!

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: You remembered! Ever since we parted ways, I've worried for you, bound for the city as you were. Never did I imagine that we would meet again, and here of all places!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We could say the very same thing to you, my friend. I'm glad to see you hale and whole. But tell me, what is this village?

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: This is Amity, a settlement made up of those who survived being exiled from Eulmore.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: As I wandered the wilds, I chanced to cross paths with an inhabitant of these parts.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: He took me through a secret tunnel which led to the top of the Bright Cliff. I've been here ever since. Life is hard, but we know a semblance of peace.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Well, we did at any rate─until Mt. Gulg broke away from the earth. Then just as suddenly, the Ladder started moving again...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And you feared whoever was coming up would threaten your lives.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Aye... But I see now there's no cause for concern. Will you tell me what has brought you here?

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: So Vauthry is a sin eater, and he's fled to Mt. Gulg...

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: 'Tis a strange tale, but I have no reason to doubt your words.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: I owe you my life. If there is anything I can do to help, you need but say the word.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Your help would be most welcome, Tristol. To begin with, we request your people's permission to reconnoiter the area.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If we are to confront Vauthry, we must find a way to reach Mt. Gulg.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Of course, you hardly need our permission to be here. I will tell the others about you and yours.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Now, we haven't much to offer in the way of hospitality, but our village is at your disposal. Please use it as you see fit in your quest.
